intro: Cyrtandra × piaensis, commonly known as the hybrid Cyrtandra, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a flowering plant characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant is native to tropical regions of the Pacific, including parts of Hawaii and Southeast Asia. Cyrtandra × piaensis often grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a hybrid species, showcasing genetic diversity within the Cyrtandra genus.
